remarks: Simplify ~ ulmval when ` F ` and ` G ` are known to be functions. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 26-Feb-2015.)
statement:
ulm2.z $e |- Z = ( ZZ>= ` M ) $.
ulm2.m $e |- ( ph -> M e. ZZ ) $.
ulm2.f $e |- ( ph -> F : Z --> ( CC ^m S ) ) $.
ulm2.b $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( k e. Z /\ z e. S ) ) -> ( ( F ` k ) ` z ) = B ) $.
ulm2.a $e |- ( ( ph /\ z e. S ) -> ( G ` z ) = A ) $.
ulm2.g $e |- ( ph -> G : S --> CC ) $.
ulm2.s $e |- ( ph -> S e. V ) $.
ulm2 $p |- ( ph -> ( F ( ~~>u ` S ) G <-> A. x e. RR+ E. j e. Z A. k e. ( ZZ>= ` j ) A. z e. S ( abs ` ( B - A ) ) < x ) ) $.
$d A j k x $.
$d B x $.
$d F j k x z $.
$d G j k x z $.
$d M j k x z $.
$d S j k x z $.
$d Z j x $.
$d j k ph x z $.
